com.samysadi.acs.utility.collections

Class Bitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.utility.collections.Bitmap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class Bitmap
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    This class keeps an optimized internal bitmap.

    It offers basic operations like marking (ie: setting to 1) and unmarking (ie: setting to 0) bits. It also, offers bitwise operations (NOT, AND, OR, XOR).

    This implementation uses a TreeMap to keep a cheap representation of the bitmap. It can contain a maximum of MAX_BITMAP_SIZE bits. So, if you try to mark or unmark bits starting from an index that is beyond this limit you will get an exception.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Bitmap.SubBitmap
      A SubBitmap is a contiguous bitmap that is defined by a starting index, and a length.

    • Method Detail

      • mark

        public void mark(long start,
        long length)
        Marks (ie: sets to 1) all the bits starting from the bit indexed with start (inclusive) to the bit indexed with start + length - 1 (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        start - the index of the first bit to be marked
        length - how many bits will be marked after the given start index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if start or length are negative or if start is greater than or equal to MAX_BITMAP_SIZE.

      • mark

        public void mark(Bitmap m)
        Marks all the bits that are marked in the given bitmap.

        This is equivalent to making a bitwise OR of current bitmap with the given bitmap.
        newBitmap = this.bitwiseOr(m);

        Parameters:
        m -

      • mark

        public void mark(long length)
        Marks (ie: sets to 1) at least length bits starting from the bit indexed with 0.

        This method will start from the index 0 looking for unmarked bits and it marks them until it marks all the given length.

        After calling this method the getMarkedSize() will be equal to:
        oldMarkedSize+length

        Parameters:
        length -

      • mark

        public Bitmap mark()
        Marks (ie: sets to 1) all bits in this bitmap and returns the old bitmap (as it was before modifications).
        Returns:
        Bitmap old bitmap, as it was before being fully marked.

      • unmark

        public void unmark(long start,
          long length)
        Unmarks (ie: sets to 0) all the bits starting from the bit indexed with start (inclusive) until the bit indexed with start + length - 1 (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        start - the index of the first bit to be unmarked
        length - how many bits will be unmarked after the given start index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if start or length are negative or if start is greater than or equal to MAX_BITMAP_SIZE.

      • unmark

        public void unmark(Bitmap m)
        Unmarks all the bits that are marked in the given bitmap.

        This is equivalent to the bitwise AND NOT of current bitmap with the given bitmap.
        newBitmap = this.bitwiseAnd(m.clone().bitwiseNot());

        Parameters:
        m -

      • unmark

        public void unmark(long length)
        Unmarks (ie: sets to 0) at least length bits starting from the bit indexed with 0.
        Note If the given length is greater than the value returned by getMarkedSize(), then a maximum of that value is unmarked.

        This method will start from the index 0 looking for marked bits and it unmarks them until it unmarks all the given length.

        After calling this method the getMarkedSize() will be equal to:
        Math.max(oldMarkedSize-length, 0)

        Parameters:
        length -

      • unmark

        public Bitmap unmark()
        Unmarks (sets to 0) all the bits in this bitmap and returns the old bitmap (as it was before modifications).
        Returns:
        a Bitmap containing old bitmap.

      • isMarked

        public boolean isMarked(long index)
        Returns true if the bit at the given index is marked (ie: equal to 1).
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        true if the bit at the given index is marked

      • getMarkedSize

        public long getMarkedSize()
        Returns the total number of bits that are marked (ie: set to 1).
        Returns:
        the total number of bits that are marked

      • getUnmarkedSize

        public long getUnmarkedSize()
        Returns the total number of bits that are unmarked (ie: set to 0).
        Returns:
        the total number of bits that are unmarked

      • getMarkedPagesSize

        public long getMarkedPagesSize(long pageSize)
        Returns the marked size based on a page boundary, where page size is given by pageSize.

        This method assumes that if a bit at a given page is marked then all the other bits in the page are marked too.

        Returns:
        the marked size based on a page boundary

      • getUnMarkedPagesSize

        public long getUnMarkedPagesSize(long pageSize)
        Returns the unmarked size based on a page boundary, where page size is given by pageSize.

        This method assumes that if a bit at a given page is marked then all the other bits in the page are marked too.

        Returns:
        the unmarked size based on a page boundary

      • bitwiseNot

        public void bitwiseNot()
        Performs a bitwise NOT on the current bitmap.
